authors: Departments of Bioengineering and Neuroscience,University of Pennsylvania,Philadelphia,PA 19104.kording@upenn.eduwww.kordinglab.com.
text: Lake et al. suggest that current AI systems lack the inductive biases that enable human learning. However, Lake et al.'s proposed biases may not directly map onto mechanisms in the developing brain. A convergence of fields may soon create a correspondence between biological neural circuits and optimization in structured architectures, allowing us to systematically dissect how brains learn.
title: Understand the cogs to understand cognition.
